fields.description:
When attaching simple text files in emails, the attachments do not show up in mail archives.
A test was also performed in [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/mail/12034]. The reply which includes a binary (zip) attachement works OK.
fields.summary: Mail archiving of simple text attachments is broken

fields.description: It looks like the settings in confluence are ignored in some way. The welcome message is not displayed, instead the default text is there. The same at login. the signup link is present even though public signup is truned off. In administration, everything is set correctly. Reverted abck to DR3 and everything works ok.
fields.summary: Welcome message and other settings ignored

fields.description: Mail that comes back in isn't parsed into header/body properly
fields.summary: Backup restore breaks mail
Remove "pool size" setting from database setup

fields.description: They seemed to just vanish around DR3.
fields.summary: Incoming Links vanished from page-operations

fields.description: Shortcut links on c.a.c were totally empty.
fields.summary: Upgrade from DR3 to DR4 broke shortcut links on confluence.atlassian.com

fields.description:
There's some creeping data problem in Confluence that occasionally results in duplicate pages with the same name. While it would be great to fix the root cause of this bug, it's been happening since 1.0.x and we still can't reliably reproduce it.

We really need to work around this. If someone calls getPage() and multiple pages are found, Confluence should pick one of the those pages to survive, and insert the others into that page's history somehow.
fields.summary: Need to patch the "duplicate page" bug

fields.description:
Derived from CONF-2076

External file references (e.g., [file://server/folder/presentation.ppt]) show up in undefined links report.
fields.summary: External file references show up in undefined pages report

fields.description:
Test cases identified so far: 

1) Query: foo123 (when page foo123 exists) returns nothing. Need to search on "foo" to get page back
2) Query: 456 (when page "bar 456" exists) returns nothing. Numbers seem to be ignored.
fields.summary: Poor search results when search query contains numbers

fields.description:
Some of these links work in Confluence others don't :

StoryCard
StoryCard
StoryCard999
StoryCard999 some text
StoryCard999 - some text
StoryCardRelease.2
SToryCard
h3. StoryCard999
fields.summary: CamelCase not consistent

fields.description:
1. export a page as XML

2. delete the space 

3. import the zip

4. view recently updated


testExport   ($content.space.name)
fields.summary: Single-page XML exports can be imported without a space

fields.description:
When trying to search our confluence site by entering a greek word in the Quick Search edit box, we get no results and the search text appears in an incorrect encoding.

Here's a sample paragraph: "Τα συνθετικά αρώματα που χρησιμοποιούνται σε απορρυπαντικά και καλλυντικά καταστέλλουν το αμυντικό σύστημα που προφυλάσσει τους υδρόβιους οργανισμούς από άλλες τοξίνες του περιβάλλοντος, υποδεικνύει έρευνα στις ΗΠΑ. Αγνωστο παραμένει αν οι ουσίες αυτές έχουν παρόμοια επίδραση και στον άνθρωπο." You can use any 'token' (say, more than 3 letters long) from the above paragraph as a search term...
fields.summary: Greek Support for Quick Search

fields.description: When exporting a page, a full set of icons and emoticons is included in the export, even if they are not used in the page. It would be nice if the zip file only included what was needed to render the page.
fields.summary: Export Page includes unneeded icons/emoticons

fields.description: Exporting a page from a space with id ABC HTML results in a zip file that has the top level page in directory lower case "abc" and the supporting borders, images etc. under upper case directory "ABC."   This means the zip file will unpack differently on Unix/Linux than it does on Windows.   This makes it difficult to use in a portable way.
fields.summary: Export page HTML has both upper & lower case space id

fields.description:
If we do space.pages.size() to get the page count, then we're effectively loading the entire space just to grab the count.

Use a direct query.
fields.summary: Speed up spaces list page

fields.description: Somehow some CVS merge comments were released in setupdbchoice.vm for 1.3DR4. This is now fixed.
fields.summary: Fix merge comment in setupdbchoice.vm

fields.description: If the file doesn't exist for a filesystem restore, it just skips to the next step (with no admin user, therefore everything's broken)
fields.summary: Restore setup step does not validate existence of file

fields.description:
example output:

-----------------snip--------------------

Subject:  	Απογευματινή Αδέσμευτη Εφημερίδα (find more)
From: 	  	David Loeng <dave@atlassian.com> (find more)
Date: 	  	Nov 15, 2004

???????????? ????????? ?????????


-----------------snip--------------------

Subject appears fine. Body isn't. Current charset: Greek charset (ISO-8859-7)
fields.summary: Character encoding issues in archiving Mail messages
Index user information

fields.description: If the email address of a mail identity matches a Confluence user, link to their profile in the view mail page.
fields.summary: Link mail sender or recipients to Confluence profiles
Collapse quoted sections in a mail

fields.description: There's no visual indication in the view at the bottom of the page that a thread may extend forward or backwards past the portion being displayed.
fields.summary: Indicate where a thread continues back or forward in mail view

fields.description:
When $req.contextPath is /, links become //display/foo/1123, which Safari decides is http://display/foo/1123

Better grep the whole source-tree for "$req.contextPath/" to find similar errors.
fields.summary: Next and previous links in mail broken when context path is /

fields.description: Browse templates look is inconsistent with admin. view and slightly disorientating - fix it.
fields.summary: 'browse templates' in admin. screen breaks with the admin decorator

fields.description: It works on the quick set up but not for the custom set up.
fields.summary: Installation of Demo content does not bring up a demo content welcome screen on custom installation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2146].
{panel}
Passwords are not encrypted in the following file:
 * confluence-mail.cfg.xml
 * confluence.cfg.xml
 * catalina.properties
 * other files that contain password

Suggestion: 
 Resolve an encryption scheme for anything requiring security stored on the file system.
fields.summary: Encrypt all passwords stored on the file system

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2145].
  {panel}

Phonetic Search / 'best match' facility.

    a) You have to spell the words right to get the document you look for which from real life experience show up to be quite 
difficult

I have looked through a lot of issues and discussion regarding confluence and I find nothing about these issue. Is this because nobody worries about it or is just because I did't search hard enough. On a previous occation I've implemented a phonetic algorithm and permutation algorithm which basically increased the number of hits by a factor of two. Both algorithms were downloaded from codguru or something similar. 2,b is of course quite simple.
fields.summary: Phonetic / best match search

fields.description:
Work in progress - the BootstrapManager and SetupPersister are steps in the right direction but there are still too many calls throughout the codebase to bootstrapManager.isSetupComplete(). 

Perhaps this form of enquiry is needless in the running of Confluence. Mosts component called should understand that they wouldn't even be called if the environment wasn't bootstrapped and the setup was not complete.
fields.summary: Clean up ConfluenceSetup

fields.description: confluence.atlassian.com comment threading was turned off mysteriously on the DR4 upgrade. Need to check other prefs.
fields.summary: Thread comments pref lost on DR3->DR4 upgrade

fields.description:
Can we get a prettier message than the current one?

java.io.IOException: Content Length Error (23067540 > 10485760)

SOmething that tells the user in English what the problem is.
fields.summary: Graceful error message upon reaching attachment filesize limit.
'Entire Thread' page in the mail archives is not so well visualized!

fields.description:
Confluence is not responsing sometimes.  We have Apache proxy as the frontend and sometimes, we will get Proxy Error from reading the response from confluence.  We have already checked that is not Apache configuration or performance issue.

Is there anything we can do to fine tune confluence?
fields.summary: Confluence has performance issue that the frontend Apache Proxy did not get response sometimes.

fields.description: Once a feed generated an error , it's impossible to fix as the cache contains a broken version...
fields.summary: Do not cache an empty/error generating rss feed

fields.description: I have included references to other blog entries in a blog entry. The appearance and behavior of the referencing blog entries is fine. However, when I check for undefined pages, this type of reference is identified as undefined, which it clearly is not.
fields.summary: Blog entries referenced within other blog entries report as undefined

fields.description: It would be nice to return to the last edited line after clicking 'Re-Edit' from the 'Preview' page.
fields.summary: Return to last edited line after clicking 'Re-Edit' from the 'Preview' page.

fields.description:
No e-mail notifications are sent for pages that users are watching. (The mail-server test e-mail works.) 

We have our user-management in Jira.
fields.summary: No e-mail notifications are sent

fields.description:
Situation:
1. A user is set deactive and is deleted afterwards while being in a deactivated state. 
2. A new user with the same name as the deleted user is created 

The user is able to log in without any problems. He can change his profile etc. 
The bug is in the admin/Manage Users Panel. The newly created user appears deactive even if the user is able to log in and perform any other user action.
fields.summary: User data not wiped out after delete

fields.description: It would be nice if you could display the recent changes panel on a content page. The panel  would show changes to this page and its child pages recursively.
fields.summary: Include recent changes as a macro

fields.description:
I would like to be able associate blog postings with a particular page or category.

The reason I would like to fo this is so I can use the blogs feature like a forum (which is what I really want).

I guess this is using blogs not for their intended purpose, but there is already the functionality there to post messages and reply to them, so I would rather use what is in confluence rather than install a full blown forum site which would have different usernames etc from my main confluence site.

If when you post a blog you could choose a category (default to name of current page?), and then in the blog macro you could set a parameter to only show posts from that category, it would achieve what I am after.
fields.summary: Associate blog post with category or page

fields.description: Please add a gzip compression filter the same as Jira
fields.summary: Add gzip filter

fields.description: In 1.3DR3 - On the space admin screen you can change the name of the space, but you can't change the key. So you end up with the old key in the breadcrumbs which is a bit crap
fields.summary: Edit space key
Recently edited portlet

fields.description: A page containing the rss-feed macro is not shown if the requested rss-feed is "down" (there's no response sent to the browser). It would certainly be better if the page could be displayed anyway; perhaps with a message stating that the feed contents can't be fetched.
fields.summary: A page containing the rss-macro is not displayed if the requested rss-feed is "down"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2126].
  {panel}

The breadcrumbs on the space look an dfeel page are not accurate. 

is:
Dashboard  >  Administration >  Look and Feel >  Edit Site Layouts

should be:

Dashboard  >  Spacename >  Look and Feel >  Edit Site Layouts
fields.summary: Modification of the Look&Feel breadcrumbs in Space Admin neccessary

fields.description:
1) Stop using prefix queries for object types
2) Stop looping through the whole resultset to determine permisisons.
fields.summary: Search performance improvements

fields.description:
Context:
The Home page in a Confuence space is renamed to OldHome, which is subsequently deleted.

Problem:
When exporting the space to PDF, the page OldHome shows up in the PDF index. This problem does not appear with HTML exporting.
fields.summary: PDF Space Export includes deleted page

fields.description:
pls try this code
------------------------
{noformat}
ps -aeo pid,args |grep java
{noformat}
-----------------------
It will result a odd format.
fields.summary: Error format when some code have '|'

fields.description:
Syntax: [$1234] will link to content with id 1234.

Currently this is how to link to a particular mail message.
fields.summary: Link to any content object by ID

fields.description: For pages that have been modified in the last day, display the last modified time as "x hours ago" or "x minutes ago". This is more useful than trying to work out what time it is now, what timezone the server is in, and so on. For pages modified more than a day ago, use the full date display.
fields.summary: Display relative times in "recent updates" lists

fields.description: Comments need to be editable (and threaded) for this product to be acceptable to many users.  Are these features planned for a near future release?
fields.summary: Editable comments

fields.description:
http://www.somesite.com/confluence/spaces/rss.action?key=SPACE&newPages=false&titleBar=false returns a RSS feed with the entire page as the description. 

It would be better to return only the excerpt in the <description> and the entire page as <content>.

Associated with this would be to improve {rss} macro to allow an option to print content or not. Currently the space summary has a portlet that shows only the title of the changed pages, it is not possible to reproduce the same information (without the entitre pages) in a Confluence page
fields.summary: Confluence RSS Feed for changed pages contain toolong description

fields.description:
I have a page (lets call it page B) with an excerpt (right at the very top) and also an included page (C) that also has an excerpt in it.
In the parent page (A) I use the children:excerpt=true macro, and it displays C's excerpt, not B's.
fields.summary: excerpt from included page used, not main one.

fields.description:
On confluence.atlassian.com TEST space, mail is not being automatically sucked down, but if you click the manual check-mail link, the mail is retrieved.

Also reported by a user on the mailing-list, so it's not just happening to us: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/mail/11274
fields.summary: POP mail box not being automatically polled

fields.summary: XML escape characters in space titles break PDF export

fields.description:
Users seem to be confused on who is the original author of a page, so I'd like to change the byline to for example: "Created by Joe Smith, Last Change by Tim Colson (Oct 18, 2004).

Why? Mike creates a page called "How to configure J2EE stuff", Tim makes a trivial spelling correction to the page, then Joe looks at the page and sends Tim an email saying, "Thanks for your configuration document! I have additional questions..." because he assumes the "Last changed...Tim Colson" means Tim is the original author.

Yes -- this did happen!

The names have been changed to protect the innocent (i.e. well, Tim and Mike are real names because I think we'll agree they really aren't all that innocent. <grin>)
fields.summary: Add Creator to page byline
Server blocks with a temporary queue

I have a template:
{noformat}@VAR@{noformat}

When using this template you cannot fill in this var.
We need assume when rendering a template for it to be filled in, all @var@ tags should be filled in.
fields.summary: When using a template look for @VARS@ in macros

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2090].
  {panel}

It would be really good to add the following two macros which would share almost the exact same functionality but have different names and different graphics/icons for use in different contexts.

1. Count Macro

So I can add the ability to have multiple counters on a page and click on the relevant counter to increment the count by 1. This is great for tracking interal requests etc. and really cool for tracking FAQ, support request popularity etc. 

A small graphical number with a small button to increase/decrease the count. Optional tracking counts would also be good. May require a small 'Counts Tracked' blurb for privacy concerns if this tracking is turned on.

2. Vote Macro

Using the same functionality but using the text 'Add your vote'. This allows us to leverage the same core Macro code but repackage it to appeal to different contexts and different users (good for evaluators/potential clients and users). Votes should probably only be able to go up though (so there would be no decrease vote option).
fields.summary: Add a count & vote macro to Confluence Macros

fields.description: A link to a blog page from a normal page ( like [/2004/10/27/Blog Post] ) comes up as an undefined page in the Space Summary Content area.
fields.summary: Links to Blog Pages are listed as undefined pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2085].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update 5th Dec 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thanks for all your votes and comments on this suggestion. We fully appreciate that organisation restructures and consolidating/importing content into Confluence is a driver for needing the ability to rename a space. 

As many would be aware from the comments, this suggestion has been open for a very long time. If this action was straightforward to implement, we would have done so a long time ago. The space key is stored as part of all content, including links to other content. In order to change it would require the entire contents of Confluence to be analysed and processed - the space key as it was implemented, is core to the relationship between content. In any large instance, such an activity must be carefully constructed to ensure that it is robust and performant at scale. We have also considered implementing a logical remapping of space keys, however have concerns that this would not solve your issues regarding consolidating/importing of content.

Whilst we see the value in this feature, the sheer complexity of implementation has pushed it out of our immediate roadmap. However, we understand how useful it would be to support this action, so we will continue to explore solutions.

Thanks again for your feedback on patience on this issue.

Cheers,

Adam Barnes | Senior Product Manager - Confluence Server
{panel}
Hey folks -
 Any chance the ability to rename the space key is in 1.3? <weak grin>

I realize this is probably a big thorny task due to links in the pages, but my users want to do it. No, let me rephrase that... some of my users are whining loudly saying they 'need' to change the key, especially for "team" spaces where the team name/acronym has changed.

*Workaround for Confluence Cloud instances with JIRA Cloud:*
 On JIRA & Confluence Cloud instances, Space imports can be linked to JIRA Projects. The process changes the Space KEY on the export file, to the JIRA Project KEY.

Export the Space and import it by linking it to a new JIRA Project with the new desired KEY:
 # In JIRA create a new project without a Confluence Space linked to it.
 # On Confluence, go to Space -> Space Tools -> Content Tools -> Export -> XML -> Next -> Full Export -> Export Space and export the target space as XMLincluding attachments.
 # Download the export
 # Go to Import Spaces
 # Select the Export and the option to link the Space import to the JIRA project created on step 1
 # Import Space
 # Verify content and remove previous space

Note: external links to Confluence Pages on the previous space will be broken.

* [How to copy or rename a space in Confluence  Confluence  Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-copy-or-rename-a-space-in-confluence-169578.html]
fields.summary: Rename Space Key

fields.description:
Restoring a single page that was previously exported as XML appears to work successfully but when viewing the pages within the space afterwards I get a row for each version of the restored page. In other words, if page that was exported had four versions, it shows up four times in the table listing all pages within the space after it is restored. This is not the normal or desired behavior for pages that have multiple versions.

The problem occurs consistently regardless of the length of the page or the number of versions.
fields.summary: Restore Page Results in Listing of Every Version

fields.description: When you click on the trashcan icon next to an attachment, the Javascript confirmation dialog asks "Do you want to delete foo version x". If the user confirms the deletion, all versions of the attachment are deleted even though the dialog indicates only the latest version of the attachment is deleted. Reproducible every time, both in local instances and confluence.atlassian.com.
fields.summary: Deleting a version of an attachment deletes all versions

fields.description:
When viewing the History (Previous Versions) of a page, the "To Previous" option in the changes column seems to compare the wrong versions. 

It is suppose to compare the version, in which row the button "To previous" was clicked, with the previous version. Instead it compares the previous version of this version with the current version of the page.
fields.summary: History: View Changes to previous version compares wrong versions
simple display url: spaceKey/ fails

fields.description:
I'd really like to have more control over how PDF's are generated. The view I see on screen and the PDF that gets generated can be very different. Also, strangely, the PDF's end up 8.26 x 11.69 inches in size instead of the standard 8.5 x 11. Weird...

Anyway these are issues I see:

  * The fonts are way too large. They look at least 50% larger than they ought to be. Maybe this can be controlled with some xml files or something but the default is pretty extreme. The results are just so different from what I see on the screen. Anyway I'd like to have an option to control the zoom of the final rendering to PDF (and a way to configure the global default as an admin in prefs).

  * Formatting is different. It looks like everything in the PDF is justified alignment, but the Confluence page is left-justified. They should be the same (and I prefer left justification) or at least have an option to control.

  * Headers and footers should be configurable with some simple macros for the top/bottom left/center/right portions (Page %p|Doc generated by Confluence version %v|%date) etc. Maybe make it global prefs for this, or local on export of the PDF.

  * Whether or not to show certain elements such as the "This page last changed on Oct 14", "Posted by sbilas", the page body, the comments section etc. should be configurable.

  * In the particular case of "This page last changed", have a "show last x changes" in the options when I export so that if it's 0, the section is gone, but if it's > 0 then it shows a little grid of who changed the page and when.

  * {code} elements should probably wrap. I have a very long line that's just extending off the page.

Lots of suggestions in one bug, I'm sorry.
fields.summary: More control over PDF exporting

fields.description:
We'd really like to see smaller URL's to connect to Confluence pages. With a really long page name you could end up with a humongous URL that just causes email programs to screw up the line wrapping.

Instead of (or in addition to) this:

  http://confluence.mycompany.com/display/MP/This+Is+A+Really+Long+Page+Title+That+One+Of+Our+Artists+Made

how about this:

http://confluence.mycompany.com/?id=23

?

Most of the time people are using URL's in confluence they're just viewing pages. Seems like that ought to be as simple and short as possible.
fields.summary: Add tiny URL support

fields.description: If you need to include a UNC file path with backslashes, you can't properly describe the root of the path. For example, the path '\\server\folder\' will treat the '\\' as a line break. There's nothing you can do short of including the text in {html} tags to make it work...
fields.summary: Line break syntax leads to ambiguity

fields.description:
When I get a report of undefined links, I find two kinds of incorrect entries in the result set.

#1 - Block entries linked into a regular page (e.g., [/2004/10/25/What I did today])

#2 - External file references (e.g., [file://server/folder/presentation.ppt])
fields.summary: Some links are reported as "undefined" when they really ARE defined

* If the mail has an in-reply-to, link to the previous message in thread
* If the mail is listed in the in-reply-to or references of other messages, try to build a thread
* Link subject to a search for other mails with that subject

fields.description: Now we store the space key in the index, it should be simpler (and significantly faster) to allow Hibernate to handle all our on-delete cascading, and then fire off an index task that removes everything with that space key from the index.
fields.summary: Removing a space doesn't unindex all its content

fields.description:
Reported by Jonas Björnerst on email:

Hello,

I really like the tasklist macro. There is a minor bug however, that I
have tested in the TEST space at confluence.atlassian.com. Doing a
preview on a newly created (unsaved) page results in:

Error rendering macro: null

After saving, previews render correctly however. It would also be nice
if links worked in a tasklist. Now they are rendered as text with square
brackets.

Jonas
fields.summary: Task list macro bug
